RoleDescription:
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Develop system test plans that cover functional, integration, system, performance, stress and regression testing scenarios.

Communicator and detail oriented.

Strong aptitude for learning new technologies.
Excellent team player, ability to interact with cross-functional teams.
Coding experience with automated testing frameworks, tools, services, and physical devices would be a plus.
Java/Python skills would be a plus.

Title: Hardware Validation Engineer
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
We are looking for a Hardware Validation Engineer. This role will involve all aspects of the fitness product hardware reliability, key component performance, and tracking electrical and certification tests of tablets, control boards, and electronic accessories.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Execute the mechanical and electrical tests of HW reliability and validation plans in the internal or 3rd party labs.


Establish HW reliability and validation plans for the new product and component, introduce the requirements in the early stages of product development to bring consistency in design, and keep improving the reliability and stability in all stages of the product life cycle.


Estimate the reliability goals, field failure rate, and failure distributions with the statistics' tool for the test plan and issue.


Generate and summarize hardware validation testing status and results and reports in order to present to the multi-functional teams (engineering and Ops teams)


Work closely with ODM/OEM partners to lock down the test plan including test specifications and test criteria for Peloton products and manage ODM/OEM on proper execution and completion of all hardware validation testing.


Work with EE and SW/FW teams to drive signal integrity, system stability, and performance tests on the vendor side.


Drive the certifications of the key feature of the electronic product and support the compliance of the safety/regulations in NA, EU, and UK markets.


Identify and track each HW-related issue and work with the team to investigate the root cause and effective corrective actions.


WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON


5+ years of experience in HW reliability testing experience


1+ years of experience in regulatory compliance design, testing, and certification


Knowledge of accelerated life testing theory/methods and reliability analysis (development, planning, and execution)


Understand NA/CA/EU safety and regulatory requirements and processes


Must be able to work well in a fast-paced environment and be an excellent teammate, ability to collaborate with multi-functional teams


Proficient oral and written skills and the ability to document and present information in comprehensive and clear ways


Experience with ODM, JDM, or CM models of reliability development


Phenomenal failure analysis skill


Supplier quality management skills, knowledge of electronics, and software coding would be a plus


Familiar and experienced with the tools and frameworks, like JIRA, Confluence, and PLM system

Lead and mentor a team of product designers, fostering a culture of deep thinking, innovation and collaboration. 
Define and drive the design vision in alignment with company objectives, ensuring our work is both impactful and deeply user-centered.
Lead design strategy and guide execution across a range of projects, focusing on our most complex feature sets that merge hardware with data-driven intelligence. 
Ensure the team delivers high-quality, impactful design solutions that sweat the details. Ability to roll up your sleeves and help the team get work over the finish line. 
Partner closely with Product, Engineering, UXR, and Analytics teams to align design goals with business and user needs.
Advocate for design thinking across the organization and drive alignment on design approaches.
Optimize workflows and design operations to increase efficiency and impact. Establish and implement best practices for prototyping, design artifacts, and interaction logic.
Champion user research and data-driven decision-making to inform design solutions, ensuring we are always putting our users first.
Advocate for accessibility and inclusivity in design, making sure our products serve and uplift a diverse range of users.
Provide coaching, feedback, and career development support to the team as well as hiring top design talent, ensuring a thriving and motivated team culture.
Oversee contributions to the companys design system, standardizing cross-functional workflows and ensuring consistency across products.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of experience designing for product experiences, with at least 5 years in a leadership role managing designers.
Strong portfolio showcasing end-to-end design processes as well as examples that demonstrate strong outcomes from your design leadership.

Excel at coaching designers to level up UX, UI, and Content Design craft while fostering an environment of continuous learning.
Proficiency in modern design tools (Figma a must) and prototyping software.
Adept at fostering cross-functional collaboration and resolving challenges before they arise, ensuring work remains exciting and rewarding.
Known for driving inclusivity and engagement within teams that leads to a positive workplace culture.
Experience in mentorship, hiring, and cultivating talent, for all levels of IC designers. 
Passion for fitness, technology, and using design to create meaningful, connected experiences that empower people to live healthier, more active lives.

Title: Manager, Site Reliability Engineering
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we treat Data as a Product - a valuable asset and a critical piece of our decision making process. The Data Foundations team is responsible for providing several capabilities:

Persistence for all client and service data, across multiple persistence solutions (PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, Redshift, Kafka, and graph databases).
Ingestion services, client libraries, and access patterns for all our operational persistence.
Retrieval services and libraries, caching services, and front-end infrastructure for engineering teams to understand and consume operational data.
Processing and routing pipelines that ensure privacy and compliance policies as data flows through the enterprise at the speed the business demands.

We are looking for an engaged, hands-on Engineering Manager to join our Data Foundations team to build and provide leadership across all four capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a passion for quality code and architecture, and will provide technical leadership as well as individual technical contribution as part of a team.Your team will be solving a wide range of problems related to data protection and security, observability across the entire ecosystem, and ensure the systems your build and support are highly available, secure, and provide the throughput our Members and Team Members demand. Our Members trust us to keep their data safe and secure, and youll play a key role in earning and keeping that trust, from guidance and implementation of data classification and retention policies, and ensuring sensitive data is protected and anonymized appropriately throughout the entire data lifecycle. As a people leader you will be responsible for career development and growth of your engineers, ensuring that they are motivated in doing their best work in line with their interests.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Staff and manage a team of engineers responsible for the Data Foundations, from data ingestion and routing, and meet all SLOs and SLAs for the products your team owns.
Be focused on eliminating toil within your team and your own customers through self-service tooling, and internally developed and published libraries for all the products you own.
Represent the Data Foundations team in internal customer meetings, cross functional workstreams,  maintain roadmaps for the team, help prioritize customer requests and drive iterative delivery of projects enabling our stakeholders to be successful. 
Establish team level performance indicators to measure efficiency of the teams output and impact to the Team Members we support.
Inspire a healthy, collaborative, empathetic engineering culture in line with Pelotons values, helping your team develop and grow along the engineering journey at Peloton.
Ensure that data pipelines are implemented with quality and observability included, along with appropriate encryption and tokenization techniques.
Partner closely with our security teams, ensuring logging and auditing mechanisms are in place and responding to any security incidents around the data infrastructure your teams support.
Champion engineering and operational excellence, drive database reliability and incident management by establishing metrics and processes for assessment and improvements.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

8+ years of software development experience in the data platform and datastores disciplines. You should be familiar with the inner workings of a data pipeline, understand the difference between streaming and batch processing data pipelines, and understand how a database engine builds a query plan.
Demonstrable experience in operating and supporting infrastructure within a cloud environment like AWS. Familiarity with orchestration tools like Kubernetes, and data orchestration services like Glue, Data Lake Formations, and Airflow is a plus.
Direct, hands-on experience in operating and managing a highly available datastore in production cloud environments (preferably AWS), such as PostgreSQL or MySQL, DynamoDB, Elasticache, or Kafka. Your team supports many different storage solutions, and familiarity with at least one is strongly preferred.
An understanding of the tradeoffs between data encryption and tokenization mechanisms, and how to manage the performance tradeoffs between them.
Prior experience managing and growing individual contributors. Your feedback and coaching is critical to the success of your Team Members.
Experience with Python or Scala (or comparable high-level language) and experience working on large distributed systems and frameworks like Spark / Flink for data pipelines.
You have a product mindset - focused on working with internal customers, prioritizing projects and iteratively delivering customer value.
The ability to identify strength and weakness of individuals in order to maximize team effectiveness and provide guidance to individuals when needed for coaching or mentoring.
The ability and experience to mediate between competing product and technical priorities and align priorities and goals through collaboration with technical leads and product managers.
Passion for building stable and secure systems management practices.
You are pragmatic without compromising on software quality and standards.

Title: Staff Product Designer, App
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a Staff Product Designer to craft simple, intuitive, and elegant experiences across our Digital Apps (iOS, Android, TV, and Web).
In this role, you'll lead end-to-end design for complex, functionality-rich interfaces, considering diverse ecosystems and screen sizes. You'll capture interactions, edge cases, and various states through user flows, wireframes, storyboards, and prototypesworking iteratively with an agile mindset. You'll collaborate closely with content designers, product managers, researchers, engineers, and fellow designers to bring features to life. Ideal candidates are strategic, proactive, highly collaborative, and open to feedback, with the ability to rapidly generate, test, and refine ideas.
Portfolio requiredplease include a live link or downloadable PDF showcasing your user-centered design work, interaction design skills, and problem-solving approach.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Lead design efforts for strategic app work streams, crafting end-to-end experiences for complex features in collaboration with peers in design, product and engineering.
Create and communicate design solutions through detailed user flows, product maps, wireframes, and prototypes.
Govern global UX patterns and information architecture, ensuring consistency and scalability across the platform.
Collaborate on systemic initiatives, such as the design system, to enhance cross-platform cohesion and efficiency.
Clearly articulate ideas and drive buy-in across app work streams, ensuring alignment on product vision and design decisions.
Coordinate user testing with UX Research, iterating quickly based on feedback and insights.
Define all user scenarios, including edge cases, error states, and logic paths for engineering implementation.
Deliver high-fidelity designs from concept to pixel-perfect handoff, providing interaction and motion prototypes.
QA for visual and functional accuracy, collaborating with engineering to refine and iterate until launch.

8+ years of software product design experience, including 5+ years as a senior individual contributor in consumer-focused tech companies.
Strong storytelling and communication skills, effectively articulating design rationale and influencing stakeholders.
Thrives in ambiguity, quickly adapting to shifting project directions and requirements.
Proven ability to ship features end-to-end from concept to production within tight timelines.
Detail-oriented with strong systems thinking, ensuring seamless multi-state, multi-path interactions and edge-case coverage.
Fast and iterative design approach, quickly generating multiple concepts while maintaining quality.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, working cross-functionally with product, analytics, research, and engineering.
User-centered and business-aware, balancing intuitive design with broader company goals.
Deep understanding of software functionality and user flows, ensuring smooth, goal-oriented experiences.
Experience designing across platforms and screen sizes, including responsive web and mobile (touch) apps.
Expertise in platform-specific design systems, patterns, and limitations for Android, iOS, and web.
Proficient in Figma, Principle, and other design/prototyping tools with experience contributing design libraries and style guides.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer III
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Personalization team at Peloton is looking for a machine learning engineer to drive personalization and recommendations for our highly engaged members across multiple platforms. Their main focus will be to optimize the engagement and discovery of Peloton content through research and application of AI and ML techniques for content recommendations. They will work closely with ML Engineers, Software Engineers, Product Managers and Product Analysts to test ideas that drive member engagement. They will have a unique opportunity to work with one of the most granular data related to member engagement in the fitness industry. Were looking for someone whos passionate about fitness and is excited about the challenges of AI and machine learning to define the future of connected fitness.

Build and improve ML pipelines that power Pelotons content recommendations.


Research and apply outstanding machine learning techniques for recommender systems.


Evaluate, implement, and improve machine learning models.


Run A/B tests and experiments and analyze the results in collaboration with our product analysts.

Collaborate and work closely with our platform teams to use their tools and infrastructure to rapidly iterate on ideas that drive delightful personalized experiences for millions of users.


 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON


Degree in highly quantitative fields including Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.


2+ years of experience working in at least one of following ML subject areas: recommender systems, natural language processing or computer vision.


Strong understanding of software engineering principles and fundamentals including data structures and algorithms.


Experience writing code in Python, Java, Kotlin, Go, C/C++ with documentation for reproducibility.


Experience with relational and non-relational databases such as Postgres, MySQL, Cassandra, or DynamoDB.


Experience writing and speaking about technical concepts to business, technical, and lay audiences and giving data-driven presentations.


MS/PhD in highly quantitative fields including Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.


Comfortable working with near real-time ML applications.


Consistent track record of working with product managers to launch ML-based product features.

Title: Program Manager, Sales Communications
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a dedicated and adaptable Program Manager, Sales Communications to join the Global Sales Enablement & Training Team. The ideal candidate will have an impressive writing background, excellent storytelling skills, and the ability to craft compelling sales messages that resonate with both business and consumer audiences. As a critical member of our team, you will be responsible for developing clear, persuasive, and targeted sales content that drives engagement, builds brand awareness, and accelerates revenue growth.
This role is perfect for a communicator who thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys creating written communication content, sales process documentation, and has a deep understanding of how to tailor messaging for both B2B and B2C sales channels. This role will support our First-Party Inside Sales and Retail teams, Third-Party Retail teams and Peloton for Business sales teams (Commercial & Corporate Wellness). You will also play a key role in shaping go-to-market messaging and using sales tools to support revenue-generating activities.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Create Persuasive Sales Content: Develop high-quality written materials, including email campaigns and virtual chat communication that effectively communicate the value of our products and membership. To craft content that supports sales initiatives, enhances lead conversion, and accelerates the sales funnel.
Leverage Sales Tools: Use sales tools, CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, Outreach, Groove)  to deliver targeted content and optimize outreach efforts. Develop email templates, sales scripts, and follow-up messages that align with sales goals and facilitate engagement.Support Sales Enablement: Develop scripts, email templates, and other sales collateral that assist the sales team in outreach and follow-up, helping them effectively communicate product benefits and close deals.
Measure Performance & Optimize for Revenue: Track and analyze the performance of all sales content and campaigns, evaluating metrics such as open rates, click-through rates, conversions, and engagement levels. Use insights to continuously optimize content, refine strategies, and ensure maximum return on investment on sales efforts.
Create Sales Content and Process Materials: Develop a variety of sales-related content and process documents, including sales playbooks, process documentation, and internal resources to standardize and streamline sales workflows.
Adapt Tone and Messaging: Tailor messaging and tone for different audiences, whether addressing business clients or individual consumers. Ensure that all content aligns with brand voice and resonates with target personas.
Support Go-to-Market Sales Team Communication: Work with the sales and marketing teams to craft go-to-market messaging for new product launches, market expansions, and promotional campaigns. Help ensure that all messaging is aligned, consistent, and impactful across all customer touchpoints.
Market Research & Industry Knowledge: Stay current on industry trends, competitor messaging, and customer pain points. Use insights to continuously improve content and strategy.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

Proven Writing Experience: 3-5 years of experience in writing for sales, marketing, or a related field. Experience in both B2B and B2C writing is strongly preferred.
Impressive Portfolio: A portfolio highlighting your talent in building captivating content for a variety of sales scenarios (emails, sales scripts, etc.).
Versatility: Ability to quickly adapt to different writing styles, whether for formal business communications or casual consumer messaging.Analytical Mentality: Ability to analyze the performance of content and make data-informed decisions to refine and optimize sales messaging.
Go-to-Market Messaging Experience: Demonstrated ability to develop and refine go-to-market messaging that supports product launches, new market entry, or sales campaigns.
Sales Tools Proficiency: Experience with CRM tools to streamline content delivery and support sales enablement.
Collaborative Spirit: Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (sales, marketing, legal, PMO, etc.).
Attention to Detail: Ability to proofread and ensure the accuracy, clarity, and effectiveness of all written materials.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Docs, and familiarity with content management systems (CMS) Salesforce (a must), Outreach and Groove (a plus)

Title: Sr. Technical Program Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
At Peloton, we view Platform as a Product. A great platform unlocks speed of development and learning. It allows us to scale easily, enabling our engineers to increase attention to new features and capabilities.  A key to crafting a great platform is data-driven insights and understanding where we should focus our attention to create the best outcomes for our members.  Platform at Peloton is a force-multiplier that enables Peloton to move faster and scale safely with minimal effort. Core to this mission is creation of the best developer experience in the tech industry for the entire spectrum of Peloton's technology.  We work across an incredible variety of technology domains: hardware, firmware, web, mobile, backend, data, messaging, content, streaming, and machine learning. We get to apply these to build a platform of products loved by millions of customers all over the world. 
We are seeking a Senior Technical Program Manager (TPM) to drive planning, project execution, and development of large-scale, cross-team initiatives.   As a Senior Technical Program Manager for Platform, you will have the opportunity to work across many domains: developer experience, core & data infrastructure, reliability engineering, and more. You will lead many exciting projects, ranging from helping us move to a microservices architecture to implementing best-in-class offering in database-as-a-service, service meshes, and API gateways. You will have the opportunity to also support our emerging work in open source and tech learning.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON


Be the glue that helps the team get things done including applying agile best practices, running meetings and collecting requirements, and coordinating larger planning activities across our teams


Help organize projects by creating project plans, identifying constraints, providing mitigation plans, and reporting status to key stakeholders


Coordinate across team lines to manage, track and deliver outcomes for our teams while managing trade-offs


Provide visibility by holding the responsibility for regular reporting to key stakeholders on project and program status


Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning with our engineers


Track and drive improvements in quality and reliability by analyzing incidents and failure as part of a continual improvement process across our engineering organization


 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of experience in software engineering and/or technical program management

Creative technical problem-solving with proven agile planning, with a track record of getting things done

Experience working with large distributed systems in critical production service environments
Experience in event/incident/problem/change management
Experience with collaboration tools like JIRA, Confluence, and Asana
Familiarity with tools and standar methodologies around developer tooling, cloud technologies, or data infrastructure
Platform-thinking and customer-centric approach

Title: Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer - Contractor
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. FATP Supplier Quality Engineer - Contractor will be focused on our component supply. This position is critical for ensuring the delivery of quality components from established suppliers and developing new suppliers to meet Pelotons quality requirements. You will manage all quality-related communication between Peloton and suppliers to manufacturing and distribution centers. As a main technical interface for our component suppliers, you will be responsible for driving problem-solving accountability (8Ds), reviewing and approving the implementation of process/part changes, and identifying opportunities for continuous improvement. You will be the responsible escalation point for internal and field concerns regarding component quality. As an individual, you are independent, highly motivated, super organized, hyper-flexible, and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment to protect and improve product quality.
*Location: Chonburi, Thailand
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Quality Systems: Maintain and improve company quality management systems (QMS) in compliance with applicable regulatory & Peloton requirements related to control of processes and product.
Management: Responsible for representing overseas quality team onsite, training, and ongoing support of staff. Required to effectively communicate project goals to Suppliers. Provide technical guidance and training (mentorship) to suppliers to their ongoing development to reach company goals. manage supplier audit program and suggest new suppliers to audit.
Product Development: Be a key member of the Peloton product development team onsite representing the Supplier Quality function. Steer and support the design control aspects of product quality, program management, and quality planning from product design through manufacturing. Assess, support and process supplier approvals and re-approvals in the approved supplier list (ASL).
Process Verification and Validation: Provide input regarding appropriate statistical methods, test facilities and equipment. This can include process validation, equipment installation/operational qualification, etc.
Production: May develop and implement quality inspection procedures including sampling plans, for production level components, sub-assemblies and finished goods. May also be responsible for the development and implementation of inspection methodologies, fixtures, measurement systems and calibration of such. Monitor, support and resolve production related quality issues with material suppliers.
Auditing: Responsible for overall audit program execution. Developing, implementing, and auditing risk-based annual quality control audit plans and schedules. Conduct and lead supplier, internal and external GMP(Good Manufacturing Practice) and ISO compliance audits. supports production line qualification initiatives, continuous improvement, and regulatory compliance across all supplier sites. Reports results and recommendations for changes as required. Confirms acceptable follow up action on audits. Monitors performance to audit schedules, execution, reporting and audit finding closures within established audit plans and timelines.
Documentation: Create, review, and approve controlled documents on an electronic document control system (e.g. supplier audit plans and reports, nonconformance reports, Quality Manual, work instructions, quality specifications, engineering specifications, lot history and device master records, procedures and validation protocols and reports, etc.). Generate and complete supplier records for approvals in the ASL.
Training: Coordinates and/or provides training to staff in GMP/ISO, Quality Systems, Supplier Quality, and Safety awareness. Provides ongoing development and maintenance of training materials and records.
Compliance: Ensures compliance with company quality policies and practices by participating in product and material reviews, assist in troubleshooting problems related to the manufacture, testing, validation and documentation. May be responsible for aspects of MRB, corrective actions, process control, complaints, document control, calibration & preventive maintenance programs and product/process/equipment validation activities.
Work with Peloton Quality Control team to develop and implement inspection and escalation plans
Coordinate disposition and cost recovery for non-conforming material from suppliers
Drive supplier root cause analysis and corrective actions (8D) and validate results ensuring proper closed-loop corrective action process
Report weekly on defect rate and quality issues
Participate in Continuous Improvement activities to drive improved part design, cost reduction, and yield improvement
Drive JDM/CM accountability and facilitate communication with Peloton Management
Track and provide updates on Quality issues
Manage monthly Quality review meetings with JDM/CM.

 
YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of experience working as a supplier quality engineer in a similar fast-paced industry
Education in Engineering/Manufacturing
Demonstrated experience in robust supplier quality and applied knowledge with ISO9001, IATF16949, APQP, SPC, MSA, FMEA, QOS, PPAP, 8D
Robust understanding of 2D drawings and GD&T
Experience with CAD tools (Solidworks knowledge is a plus)
Capable to perform Gage R&R, capability studies
Lean/Six Sigma, Green or Black Belt a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to identify bottlenecks in a process and drive improvement

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

Title: SOX ITGC (UAR) Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a skilled SOX ITGC Manager to lead our Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance efforts with a particular focus on User Access Review (UAR) controls and Identity Governance. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT general controls, risk management, and identity management frameworks. This role will be responsible for overseeing and managing the execution of the SOX User Access Review process to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and company policies. This role requires a strong understanding of information security principles, regulatory requirements, and the ability to collaborate with external auditors, internal audit teams, and business leaders to ensure robust compliance with SOX controls and effective management of user access reviews. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in SOX compliance, audit management, and cross-functional collaboration.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

SOX Compliance Management:Oversee and manage SOX compliance activities related to IT General Controls (ITGC), ensuring timely execution of UAR and other related controls.
User Access Review (UAR):Design, implement, and monitor UAR processes to ensure that user access is appropriate and complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Identity Governance:Develop and maintain an identity governance framework to manage user identities, roles, and access rights across systems, ensuring least privilege access principles are adhered to.
Risk Assessment:Conduct regular risk assessments related to ITGC and identity management. Identify potential risks and recommend mitigation strategies to senior management.
Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all SOX controls, including policies, procedures, and process flows. Prepare and present regular compliance reports to management and auditors.
Collaboration:Work closely with IT teams, internal audit, and external auditors to facilitate audits and ensure compliance with SOX requirements.
Interface with External Auditors:Serve as the primary point of contact for external auditors regarding ITGC and UAR controls, ensuring that all necessary documentation and information are provided in a timely manner.
Training and Awareness:Develop training programs for staff on SOX compliance, UAR controls, and best practices in identity governance to foster a culture of compliance within the organization.
Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvements in compliance practices and implement best practices in identity governance.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, or a related field.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT compliance, risk management, or audit, with a focus on SOX.
Strong understanding of ITGC frameworks, SOX requirements, and UAR controls.
Experience with UAR identity governance tools (Sailpoint, CyberArk)
Familiarity with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are a plus

Design, develop, and optimize FATP lines to enhance production efficiency, product quality, and cost-effectiveness, balancing low-cost automation and industrialization requirements.

New Product Introduction (NPI):
